page.title: 19CORNISH WRESTLING
page.content: Sithney Cornish Wrestling Club uses Sithney C.P. School for winter training and Chynhale Sports Club field for summer practices and tournaments. The sport of Cornish Wrestling has a long and colourful history and Cornish wrestlers are recorded as having entertained the Royal Court in Tudor times on a number of occasions. The Sithney Club is at the forefront of a revival of interest in the sport and the number of members has increased in recent years. Training is offered to men and boys over the age of eight. Contests take place within a sawdust circle and wrestlers wear only shorts and a hessian jacket which can be seized by an opponent to assist in making a throw.
